column2: Network Level Measures and common security measures

As we are regulated by Bangladesh Bank as a payment processing platform, we need to maintain certain security compliance which cannot be disclosed here. The security compliance is similar to the PCI DSS compliance which I can say.
As our product is still under development, no thought has gone into security of the product yet.
I don't have to worry about it
network security control, identity and access managemen,  password encryption, using latest technology
use encryption at different level of software (server, network, transmission layer, database and software layer.)
Security testings like: SQL injection, cross-site scripting, CSRF, API security, use of https,  detecting malicious / suspicious HTTP requests and auto-blocking
We use github/bitbucket repository systems to code maintain and store. We use server side security on AWS and other third party server host.
Usually I implement both client and server side data validation, escape html entities, disable indexing.
Common Security Practices isn't broken, SSL, Authentication
We run security audit of our office environment. We also conduct security session per 6 months to introduce latest trend in threats and what we can do to avoid it.
We use proper validations (both client and server side), make stored procedures secured and ensure proper access control.
So far this thing has not been my headache.
At application level, could not achieve others yet
rely on Using Tools to suggest security flaws so that those could be fixed.
https, popular framework which already prevents some type of attacks. rest of the things on case-by-case basis.
ISO 270001 procedures and controls are in practice
Token based authentication for all of my rest service
Multi Prong Standard Processes and Products
We have implemented/used https, VPN, access control etc
User login authentication and csrf protection.
Start from the beginning and keep going,Quality maintain,Design with the future in mind
Spring Boot framework will be used in back-end development. And spring boot Security is so much strong.
We use a security scanner tool amd fix accrodingly
Multi Prong Standard Processes and Products
There are some basic guidelines that we must follow and while code review this needs to be an absolute part that needs to be checked before the code gets merged.
We convert the codes to binary. Since we use python, it is the most convenient and economical solution for us.
OAuth 2.0, JWT, Token Base Authentication, CORS Filter, XSRF
apache shiro , java ee secuirty - keyclock, HDiv,
Following industry standard and best practices, also we arrange hacking session internally to break own security vulnerabilities
